title.narrative: PESRTD land inventory in Burkina Faso 2017-2021

description.narrative: Jorderosionen minskar Burkina Fasos jordbrukspotential och landets regering ämnar utarbeta en strategi och en arbetsplan för att vända den negativa trenden. Som underlag för dessa krävs en inventering av marktillståndet i landet. Insatsen syftar till att finansiera denna inventering inkl förslag på handlingsprogram. Arbetet samordnas av miljöministeriet och i det deltar även jordbruksministeriet och andra myndigheter. Insatsen har en budget om 500 000 kr för fas 1 men genom avtalstillägg nr 3 ökades denna till 1 573 000 kr samtidigt som aktivitetsperioden förlängdes till 20211031 och avtalets giltighet till 20220522.

Soil erosion is reducing the agricultural potential in Burkina faso and the country's government will therefore formulate a strategy and a work plan for reversing the negative trend. As a basis for these, a national inventory of the soil condition is necessary. The contribution aims at funding such an inventory and the formulation of a draft work plan. This work will be coordinated by the Ministry of Environment and carried out in collaboration with the Ministry of Agriculture and other governemental actors. The contribution had initially a budget of 500 000 SEK but it was increased to 1 573 000 kr with the agreement amendment no 3 and the activity period extended to 20211031 as well as the agreement's validity to 20220531.

title.narrative: 11281 PESRTD-NDT decision on agreement amendment no 3 20210317

description.narrative:
The first part of the contribution resulted in the finalization of a inventory study on the state of soils & vegetation and the identification of causes of the degradation in all of Burkina Faso between 2013-2020. This study is of a high strategic importance to Burkina Faso.
In the second part, strategic work has been done in formulation and validation of one national and 13 regional actions plans, with the aim of achieving land degradation neutrality. These are integrated into the national development program for the rural sectors, PNSR3. This also includes the creation of the National coalition for sustainable land management.
The definition of land degradation neutrality is formulated as follows by the UN Convention on Desertification:
A state whereby the amount and quality of land resources, necessary to support ecosystem functions and services and enhance food security, remains stable or increases within specified temporal and spatial scales and ecosystems.
After the start-up period in 2017, funded by the World Bank, the project has achieved the following main results on funding by Sweden:
- Extensive generation of information on land use, land productivity, land degradation and soil carbon storage in the countrys 13 regions, divided into four geographical clusters;
- A report that summarizes the information above for the whole country;
- Detailed reports and action plans for each of the 13 regions with the same information plus proposed targets and measures to achieve land degradation neutrality.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
